results.title: An Astronaut's view of earth
results.creator_credit: Joseph Blatt, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: An Astronauts view of the earth explores the history behind the development of space photography and discusses how human perceptions of themselves have been changed by this. A planet amongst planets, satellite photography has taught us about human scale and provides us with a snapshot of humans’ affect on the environment. A number of space shuttle astronauts draw connections between their work and the environment, science philosophy and history. With striking footage throughout, most notable being a full circle of the earth filmed from a satellite 180 miles out from earth. From the first aerial photograph to the sophisticated IMAX cameras this documentary charts the development of the technology used to photograph and film the earth and reveals a fragility of the earth with increasing clarity. Introduced by Dr. Patrick Moore, leading world cosmologist and narrated by William Shatner with music score by David Byrne and Pat Irwin.

results.title: An Approach for developing mathematical concepts
results.creator_credit: Dennis Claringbold and Melbourne College of Advanced Education. Media Production Centre
results.brief_description: Ross McKeown conducts a maths lesson for Year 2 students from Boronia Heights Primary School using the following steps. 1. Introduce concepts using concrete materials. 2. Games to reinforce concept. 3. Further practice and revision of concept. 4. Evaluation and recording of progress. Uses the concept of place value to demonstrate these techniques.

results.title: An Airplane trip: an instructional sound film
results.brief_description: An instructional film of a plane trip. Dorothy and her mother travel from Los Angeles to salt Lake City. Shows and explains the duties involved in maintaining and servicing such a trip through the mechanics, stewardesses, and pilots and also includes the panoramic views as seen through the eyes of the passengers.

results.title: An Afternoon with Grigor Piatigorsky
results.brief_description: The life and art of one of this centuries greatest exponents of the cello. He performs the exquisite minuets 1 and 2 from the suite by Johann Sebastian Bach.

results.title: Amy on the lips
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film “Amy” starring Jenny Agutter and Barry Newman. Shows the attempts by one woman to teach deaf children to speak at the turn of this century. Suitable for Upper Primary, Early Secondary students. No other credits available.

results.title: Amphibians: frogs, toads and salamanders. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Uses excellent close-up photos and cinematography to show a typical amphibian life-cycle and to study the differences between three kinds of amphibians - frogs, toads and salamanders. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Amphibians: frogs, toads and salamanders
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: Presents the life cycles, habits and general characteristics of amphibians - frogs, toads and salamanders. Points out characteristics shared by the creatures and how they differ. Explains the changes which occur during metamorphosis as well as their anatomical and physiological characteristics.

results.title: Among the wild chimpanzees
results.creator_credit: Barbara Jampel and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Presents an account of Jane Goodall’s continuing research project with wild chimpanzees in Tanzania. Details her discoveries that chimpanzees not only use but also make tools, they hunt meat and even kill one another. They also suffer from infectious human diseases. Suitable for Upper Primary and Secondary School students.
